trans-unit.source: The exception that is thrown when an error condition prevents some attributes from being committed by a <xref href="System.Printing.PrintSystemObject"></xref> to the actual computer, printer, or device that the object represents.
Classes within the <xref:System.Printing> namespace are not supported for use within a Windows service or ASP.NET application or service.
Attempting to use these classes from within one of these application types may produce unexpected problems, such as diminished service performance and run-time exceptions.
If you want to print from a Windows Forms application, see the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing> namespace.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Printing.PrintCommitAttributesException"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Printing.PrintCommitAttributesException"></xref> class and provides it with the specified message.
A description of the error condition.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Printing.PrintCommitAttributesException"></xref> class by using the specified <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> and <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext"></xref>.
Stores all the data that is used to serialize the object.
Describes the context of the serialized stream, including the source and the destination.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Printing.PrintCommitAttributesException"></xref> class by using the specified message and the inner <xref href="System.Exception"></xref>.
A description of the error condition.
The underlying condition that triggered the <xref href="System.Printing.PrintCommitAttributesException"></xref>.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Printing.PrintCommitAttributesException"></xref> class by using the specified error code, and the success and failure collections.
An <xref href="System.Int32"></xref> that is interpreted as an HRESULT, a coded numerical value that is assigned to a specific exception.
A collection of strings that name the attributes that your program successfully committed.
A collection of strings that name the attributes that your program was unable to commit.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Printing.PrintCommitAttributesException"></xref> class by using the specified error code, message, and object name, and the success and failure collections.
An <xref href="System.Int32"></xref> that is interpreted as an HRESULT, a coded numerical value that is assigned to a specific exception.
A description of the error condition.
A collection of strings that name the attributes that your program successfully committed.
A collection of strings that name the attributes that your program was unable to commit.
The object that generated the exception.
Gets a <xref href="System.Collections.ObjectModel.Collection`1"></xref> of the names of the attributes that were successfully committed.
A <xref href="System.Collections.ObjectModel.Collection`1"></xref> of strings that identify the <xref href="System.Printing.PrintSystemObject"></xref> attributes that were successfully committed.
Gets a <xref href="System.Collections.ObjectModel.Collection`1"></xref> of the names of the attributes that were not committed.

A <xref href="System.Collections.ObjectModel.Collection`1"></xref> of strings that identify the <xref href="System.Printing.PrintSystemObject"></xref> attributes that your program was unable to commit.
Gets information about the serialization of the object and the context of the serialized stream.
Stores all the data that is used to serialize the object.
Describes the context of the serialized stream, including the source and the destination.
Gets the name of the object that threw the exception.

A <xref href="System.String"></xref> reference to the <xref href="System.Printing.PrintSystemObject.Name"></xref> property of the <xref href="System.Printing.PrintSystemObject"></xref> that threw the exception.
